entry.title: C_PURCHASEORDERITEMDEX - Add the creation date field of the purchase order item
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I recently raised a case with SAP regarding the standard CDS View for purchase order items, C_PURCHASEORDERITEMDEX, which currently returns the header creation date for all items. After reviewing the case, the SAP support team confirmed that this is the expected behavior and suggested submitting an idea on their Influence platform. My ERP is S/4HANA Public Cloud.

The goal of this blog post is to gather support from the community so that this improvement can be prioritized. If you agree that having the correct item-level creation date would add value, please take a moment to vote for my idea on the SAP Influence website. Your vote can make a real difference!

https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/362226

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,

Miquel

entry.title: Corrective invoice template for Poland
entry.content:
We do the roll-out of S4 Hana public cloud in Poland

We use the process for corrective invoice (document type RK) for customers. In this specific flow we have the initial invoice items (item category G2N) and the correction items (item category L2N)

On the billing document output (PDF template) we would like to have a split in item to clearly mention the initial items and then the corrected one. This is a common practice in Poland. In the item section the invoice should look like this :

Before correction

item frame with initial items (G2N)

After correction

item frame with corrected items (L2N)

The requirement is basically to split the item frame in 2 sub item frame (by item category) and add a title to each sub frame

In a previous post, you adviced this  

' In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the standard output templates (Billing Document PDF) do not allow you to split item frames by item category (e.g., G2N vs L2N) out of the box. To achieve the Polish corrective invoice requirement, you need to extend the output form using Adobe Form customization in the Output Management framework. The approach is to add conditional logic in the form template that groups items by item category and prints them under separate titled sections (“Before correction” and “After correction”)

Can you please reply to these additionnal questions ?

  • Are you referring to using Adobe Livecycle Designer to modify the form, or do you recommend another program?
  • From what I understand from your comment, are you saying that in order to create a second table with the items, we must read the items by development (programming in Adobe LiveCyle Designer), or could we obtain both tables by adding a standard section?

Thanks a lot

entry.title: Settlement rule from AUC to Final asset works only for first ledger
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a problem with settlement from AUC to Final Asset. During year, settlement from WBS to AUC and to FA worked well, but last month something changed, and settlement from AUC to FA does not work as expected. Settlement is done only for first ledger. Meaning, when first settlement is done in 0L it is done correctly, but in 2L afterwards is it not. And viceversa, if first settlement is done in 2L, then in 0L it does not work and we get error message that there is nothing to settle, even though the value "sits" on AUC in 0L ledger. Master data of final asset is also correct. Settlement from WBS to AUC works well for both ledgers.

This happens only for one specific project, other projects work well.

We tried changing settlement rule from percentage to sums and back, no change.

Please, any ideas?

entry.title: Corrective invoice for Poland - Output template PDF
entry.content:
We do the roll-out of S4 Hana public cloud in Poland

We use the process for corrective invoice (document type RK) for customers. In this specific flow we have the initial invoice items (item category G2N) and the correction items (item category L2N)

On the billing document output (PDF template) we would like to have a split in item to clearly mention the initial items and then the corrected one. This is a common practice in Poland. In the item section the invoice should look like this :

Before correction

item frame with initial items (G2N)

After correction

item frame with corrected items (L2N)

The requirement is basically to split the item frame in 2 sub item frame (by item category) and add a title to each sub frame

 

Your advice was :

'In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the standard output templates (Billing Document PDF) do not allow you to split item frames by item category (e.g., G2N vs L2N) out of the box. To achieve the Polish corrective invoice requirement, you need to extend the output form using Adobe Form customization in the Output Management framework. The approach is to add conditional logic in the form template that groups items by item category and prints them under separate titled sections (“Before correction” and “After correction”)

Can you please advise a bit more ?

  • Are you referring to using Adobe Livecycle Designer to modify the form, or do you recommend another program?
  • From what I understand from your comment, are you saying that in order to create a second table with the items, we must read the items by development (programming in Adobe LiveCyle Designer), or could we obtain both tables by adding a standard section?

entry.title: Payment Advice API - Field Mapping Questions for Payment Reference and Reference Items (F2550)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm working with the Manage Payment Advice (F2550) app in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition and have questions about the API field mappings when using the API_PAYMENT_ADVICE_SRV.

Question 1: In the Manage Payment Advice app (F2550), what does the "Payment Reference" field in the header represent? Is it the Accounting Document ID or the Billing Document ID? Please clarify explicitly.

Question 2: In the Manage Payment Advice app (F2550), what does the "Reference" field in the line items represent? Is it the Accounting Document ID or the Billing Document ID? Please clarify explicitly.

Question 3: By populating these fields in the app (F2550), can we establish linkages to related documents that are visible in the document flow?

Question 4: When posting the header "Payment Reference" field via the API (https://api.sap.com/api/API_PAYMENT_ADVICE_SRV/cloud-sdk/ABAP), which specific field in the API payload should be specified?

Question 5: When posting the line item "Reference" field via the API (https://api.sap.com/api/API_PAYMENT_ADVICE_SRV/cloud-sdk/ABAP), which specific field in the API payload should be specified?

I would greatly appreciate if you could answer according to the question numbers above. Direct answers to each numbered question would be most helpful.

Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: Issue with Electronic Credit Notes – Missing Period Dates and Email Mapping (Colombia Localization)
entry.content:
Hello,

We would like to request your support regarding an issue we are currently facing with electronic credit notes in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition – Colombia localization.

At the moment, we are actively working on electronic invoicing, and we have already validated that standard electronic invoices are being generated and sent correctly to the tax authority, without any issues. These documents are being processed successfully and are compliant.

However, now that we are starting to work specifically with electronic credit notes, we have identified errors during the generation and submission of the electronic document to the Colombian tax authority (DIAN).

Issue description

When the electronic credit note is sent to the tax authority, the following errors are returned:

  1. Missing period dates
    The XML file generated by the system is not populating certain mandatory fields related to:

    • Start date of the billing period

    • End date of the billing period

    These dates seem to be required by the tax authority and associated with some part of the document, but we are unable to identify where these fields should be captured or derived from within the credit note document in the system. The system does not appear to recognize or populate these values in any section of the XML.

  2. Customer / Vendor email not mapped
    We are also receiving an error indicating that the email address is not informed for the customer or vendor involved in the credit note.

    However, we have validated that:

    • The email address is correctly maintained in the Business Partner master data.

    • Despite this, the email is not being mapped or reflected in the electronic document, resulting in the error message from the tax authority.

Request for support

We would appreciate your help to understand:

  • Why these fields (period start and end dates) are not being populated in the XML for electronic credit notes.

  • From which configuration or document fields these values should be derived.

  • Why the customer/vendor email, although maintained in master data, is not being mapped into the electronic document.

  • If there are specific configuration points related to Document & Reporting Compliance / Statutory Reporting for Colombia that should be reviewed or adjusted for credit notes.

We would especially appreciate guidance from someone with experience in Colombia localization and electronic document compliance configuration.

Evidence

Attached you will find:

  • Screenshots of the system errors.

  • The messages returned by the tax authority.

  • Supporting evidence showing the master data configuration.

Thank you in advance for your support. We look forward to your guidance to resolve these issues as soon as possible.

entry.title: RAP: How to enable/disable a field when entering a value on another field in Object Page?
entry.content:
I would to know how can I trigger the feature control when I try to input a value into a field then make another field enable/disable?

I understand there is side effects function but I dont see where I can attach the "features : instance"

edit: i've already applied the field ( features : instance ) MyField; 

but when the features control method is triggered, it doesnt pick up the updated data (entered data). My next question is how can I retrigger the features control after determination on modify?

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud – Is it possible to add a 4th Receiver Role in Billing Document Output
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

We are working on Billing Document Output Management in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud using BRF+ (Manage Output Determination Apps).

In Receiver determination (DT_RECEIVER), the system allows only the following standard roles for Billing Document:

  • RE (Bill-to Party)

  • AG (Sold-to Party)

  • RG (Payer)

Our business requirement is to print 4 copies of the Billing Invoice (Original, Duplicate, Triplicate, and Extra Copy).

We checked if an additional receiver role (for example, a 4th role or custom role) can be added in Output Management, but Public Cloud does not seem to support custom partner roles.

Question:

  • Is it technically possible in S/4HANA Public Cloud to add a 4th receiver role for Billing Document output determination?

  • If not, is the only supported approach to handle multiple invoice copies inside a single Adobe Form?

Any official confirmation or SAP note reference would be very helpful.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: How to Monitor Missing Bank Statements in SAP
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We recently encountered an issue where bank statements were not received in SAP from the bank for the past 20 days due to some technical problems. Unfortunately, there was no communication about this, and we only identified the issue today.

Could anyone suggest how to monitor such situations when bank statements are not received regularly? Is there any functionality in SAP to set up notifications or alerts if statements are missed?

Thanks,
Naveen Kumar

entry.title: Can S4 Public Cloud Customers (2SL) do configuration after Q System upgrade and before PROD upgrade?
entry.content:
Seek expert guidance if 2SL  (System Landscape) S4 Public Cloud Customer can do configuration after Q System upgrade and before PROD upgrade.

If 2SL S4 Public Cloud Customer make some configuration changes after Q System upgrade but before PROD upgrade, what customer actions recommended for safety? Shall the customer double check if the those specific configurations work fine in Production system after Production system upgrade? Thanks.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/b249d650b15e4b3d9fc2077ee921abd0/90e9f061ea7349339af5c5d…

In your test system, you carry out regression tests of the upgraded software with your developer extensibility artifacts and the existing content, to prepare for the software upgrade in the production system. To support the regression tests during this time window, it is recommended to keep the test system stable and not import new transports into the test system. However, although the test system is already at one higher software release than the other systems, transports can be imported into the test system and be forwarded to the production system. There is no interruption in the four weeks in the transport landscape.

Question in Original Chinese:  希望专家指导解读如上帮助文档， 是否S4 Public Cloud 两系统的客户在升级期间 Quality系统升级以后仍被允许在 Quality系统做配置？

帮助文档的描述：S4 Public Cloud 两系统的客户在升级期间 Quality系统升级以后，Production还没升级的时候，不建议在测试系统导入新的配置；然而，虽然测试系统已升级到更高版本，系统传输仍可导入到测试系统并传输到生产系统。

如果S4 Public Cloud 两系统的客户在升级期间 Quality系统升级以后在 Quality系统做了配置，有什么专家建议的客户操作以确保安全么？比如客户在Production系统升级后，特别检查这些在Quality系统升级后而Production系统尚未升级时，在Quality系统做的配置是否在Production系统良好运行？非常感谢。

entry.title: CDS view for Code Groups
entry.content:
Hi,

We are creating a report for result recording against inspection lots and have identified most CDS views. However, we are not able to find the CDS view for code groups. We found "I_INSPECTIONCODEGROUP", but it does not have the information of Code & short text for code under the code group.

Kindly suggest which CDS view should we refer to fetch code group details?

In the attached screenshot, the CDS view is required for the highlighted section.

entry.title: Custom field has no value help in some screens but has in others
entry.content:
Hello community.

We have created a custom field in SAP S/4Hana Public Cloud, assigned a value help view and enabled the usage in all possible scenarios.

The field is Code List based on CDS View and the context is Accounting: Coding Block (FINS_CODING_BLOCK) .

 

In apps like Post General Journal Entries the value help works.

However in some apps like FB60 and FB70 we see the field but when clicking on the value help button, the value help window doesn't show up.

 

Why is that? How can we achieve the same behaviour across all screens?

Thanks.

Kostadin

entry.title: Credit block sales order whenever there is a change in terms of payment field after release
entry.content:
• Modifying the Terms of Payment should trigger a credit check that re-block the Sales Order after Sales Order has been created/released.
  • Changing the header data does not block the Sales Order, and no credit check run is executed due to this change.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Can S4 Cloud ERP Public Cloud support to manage Swiss QR Code Bills
entry.content:
Can S4 Cloud ERP Public Cloud support to manage Swiss QR Code Bills and meet below requirement?

The customer is moving from local AMS ERP to S4 Cloud ERP Public Cloud, emphasized below requirement:

This regulation is of interest to ASC.  QR invoices and adjustments to master data. Maybe interesting for SAP S4 Public Cloud implementation:

Changes in payment transactions QR-bills / payment orders in ISO 20022 format structured addresses mandatory – Swiss state law
The most important innovation is the mandatory use of structured addresses in QR-bills as of the 21st November 2025, which requires an adjustment of the master data and software. Here, only structured addresses (address type "S") are allowed in the QR-bills.

As of November 2026 at the latest, structured addresses are also mandatory for all payment orders in ISO 20022 format.

The new standards, which are based on the 2019 version of the ISO 20022 standard, require the splitting of addresses into individual, defined fields (e.g. street, house number, postal code, city, country) instead of the earlier, unstructured text fields.

The aim of this amendment is to increase the efficiency and accuracy of payment transactions and to simplify cross-border and digital payments.

All relevant adjustments have been made by DIAMANT with software version 1.8.02. In addition, as of this software status, the invoicing party is now also transferred from the QR code to the Account Holder field. Previously, this name was only transferred to the Name field of the open item address.

Customer's requirement in original German language: 

Änderungen im Zahlungsverkehr QR-Rechnungen / Zahlungsaufträge im ISO-20022-Format strukturierte Adressen verpflichtend – Landesrecht Schweiz
Die wichtigste Neuerung ist die verpflichtende Nutzung strukturierter Adressen in QR-Rechnungen ab dem 21. November 2025, welche eine Anpassung der Stammdaten und Software erfordert. Hier sind nur noch strukturierte Adressen (Adress-Typ «S») in den QR-Rechnungen erlaubt.
 
Spätestens ab November 2026 sind zusätzlich dann für alle Zahlungsaufträge im ISO-20022-Format strukturierte Adressen verpflichtend.

Die neuen Standards, die auf der Version 2019 des ISO 20022-Standards basieren, verlangen die Aufteilung von Adressen in einzelne, definierte Felder (z.B. Straße, Hausnummer, Postleitzahl, Ort, Land) anstelle der früheren, unstrukturierten Textfelder.

Diese Änderung soll die Effizienz und Genauigkeit im Zahlungsverkehr erhöhen und die grenzüberschreitenden sowie digitalen Zahlungen vereinfachen.
 
Alle relevanten Anpassungen sind durch den Hersteller DIAMANT mit dem Softwarestand 1.8.02 erfolgt. Zusätzlich wird ab diesem Softwarestand nun auch der Rechnungssteller aus dem QR-Code in das Feld Kontoinhaber übernommen – bisher war dieser Name nur in das Feld Name der OP-Adresse übernommen worden.
